alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 5:57PM EDT until August 07 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Delaware...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in northern Delaware...New Castle. In southeast Pennsylvania...Chester and Delaware. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Rainfall totals of 1 to 2 inches are possible in a short amount of time. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Wilmington, Newark, Middletown, West Chester, Coatesville, Westtown, Downingtown, Elsmere, Kennett Square, New Castle, Oxford, and Parkesburg. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 304 and 319. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 0 and 16. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
